post.title: Phoebe Chan Departs Shirayuri Pro to Become Independent VTuber
post.content:
VTuber Phoebe Chan from US-based VTuber project Shirayuri Pro has announced her departure from the group to become a fully independent VTuber. The announcement was first made during the VTuber group‚Äôs second-year anniversary stream.

According to a statement she posted on Twitter, her departure takes effect on September 1, and has encouraged fans to look forward to her re-debut and birthday celebration on October 28.

„ÄêNotice„Äë

As announced during our 2-year anniversary stream today, I have decided to leave @ShirayuriPro and return to being a fully independent VTuber.

Thank you for supporting me always! pic.twitter.com/91fzOeSYCn

— Phoebe Chanüêùüå∏| ShirayuriPro @ SDC 2022 (@feebeechanchibi) August 20, 2022

‚ÄúGoing forward, I intend to focus mainly on my singing and music, convention performances, and appearances, and growing my voice acting career. To clarify, however, I will not be graduating as Phoebe, nor will I be ceasing my VTubing activities,‚Äù she stated.

Phoebe Chan, also known by her moniker as ‚ÄòFeebeechanchibi‚Äô, describes herself as a ‚Äò2.5D singer and voice actress‚Äô. Aside from her VTubing career, she has also devoted her time to creating original music and performing in the idol group PhEri. She recently released her second original single ‚ÄúSymphonic Sky‚Äù, which was released on April 29 this year.

Some of her other music-related releases include her first original solo EP, Moon Garden (March 2020), and Chill Bee-Ts to Buzz to (April 2021).

post.description: VTuber Phoebe Chan from US-based VTuber project Shirayuri Pro has announced her departure from the group to become a fully independent VTuber.

node.title: AniManGaki 2022 VTuber Highlights

node.description: A few weeks ago, we reported that AniManGaki 2022, one of the biggest annual anime/cosplay/gaming events in Malaysia, will showcase 80 VTubers.
